docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students estimate the amount of money a non-smoking teen spends in a week, a month, and a year, and compare it with the expenses of a teen who smokes one, two, and three packs a day. They then research other reasons that teens should not smoke, and create an ad campaign geared toward young people emphasizing the financial and health benefits of not smoking.
